name: DotNetDataBot
body:
## Welcome to the documentation of DotNetDataBot
DotNetDataBot is an extension of [DotNetWikiBot](http://dotnetwikibot.sourceforge.net/) to fit to [Wikibase](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Extension:Wikibase), an extension of [MediaWiki](https://www.mediawiki.org/). It is written in [C#](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C_Sharp_%28programming_language%29) and runs on [.NET Framework](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/vstudio/aa496123.aspx) 4.0, perhaps even lower.

### Download
The source code will be published soon but you can download the compiled documents before. Click [here](https://github.com/downloads/Benestar/DotNetDataBot/DotNetDataBot.zip) to get the package. After unpacking it you can see a file called `DotNetDataBot.dll` and one called `DotNetDataBot.xml`. The xml document is only for documentation. To use it you have to create a new refer in your project. Then you can write `using DotNetDataBot;` to import the framework.

### Example
Here is a short example how you can use DotNetData framework:
```
using DotNetDataBot;

namespace MyBot
{
    class Example
    {
        public static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            Site site = new Site("http://www.wikidata.org", "username", "password"); // replace username and password with you bot's login data
            Item item = new Item(site, "Q1000");
            item.setSiteLink("en", "Earth"); // sets the sitelink

            Item newItem = new Item(site);
            newItem.createItem("en", "Wikidata", "database for collecting interwikilinks"); // creates a new item
        }
    }
}
```

### References
This framework was originally created for [User:BeneBot*](http://www.wikidata.org/wiki/User:BeneBot*). If you have any questions, you can also ask them at the bot's userpage.

tagline: Extension of DotNetWikiBot framework for Wikibase extension of Mediawiki
